required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Quality of Life After Transanal Endoscopic Microsurgery (TEM)
clinical_study.official_title: Quality of Life After Transanal Endoscopic Microsurgery (TEM) for Rectal Neoplasm

lead_sponsor.agency: State Scientific Centre of Coloproctology, Russian Federation

clinical_study.source: State Scientific Centre of Coloproctology, Russian Federation

brief_summary.textblock: This is a observational cohort study to determine the influence of Transanal endoscopic microsurgery (TEM) on patients Quality of Life

detailed_description.textblock: Patients who planning Transanal Endoscopic Microsurgery (TEM) for rectal neoplasms should undergoing fecal incontinence quality of life scale and Wexner score before and after surgery for measurement their quality of life. For objectification data sphinctrometry will be perform.

primary_outcome.measure: Fecal incontinence quality of life scale
primary_outcome.description: The FIQL is a standardized instrument that can be used to assess QOL issues related to fecal incontinence.The Fecal Incontinence Quality of Life Scale is composed of a total of 29 items; these items form four scales: Lifestyle (10 items), Coping/Behavior (9 items), Depression/Self-Perception (7 items), and Embarrassment (3 items).Each aspect is described as a score measured on a scale between 1 and 4, where 1 is very affected and 4 is not affected

secondary_outcome.description: Wexner score is composed of a total 5 items for each type of incontinence. Each aspect is described as a score measured on a scale between 1 and 4, where 0 is rarely, 4 - always/ 0 - perfect, 20 - complete incontinence.

intervention.description: Sphincterometry is a method of the spincter function examination, which allows to assess the state of the anal sphincter muscle and its function

study_pop.textblock: Patients with rectal neoplasms with planning transanal endoscopic microsurgery (TEM)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have a planned of Transanal endoscopic microsurgery (TEM)
- Have signed approved informed consent form for the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- non epithelial malignancy
- recurrent neoplasm
- stoma formation
